explanation: Google was founded in 1998 by Larry Page and Sergey Brin.

answers: Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, Ronald Wayne
explanation: Apple founded in 1976 by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, Ronald Wayne.
Microsoft founded 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
ENIAC (1945) - first general-purpose electronic digital computer. Huge, vacuum tubes.
UNIVAC (1951) - first commercial computer produced in US.

answers: Ancient calculating tool - beads on rods
explanation: Abacus - ancient manual calculator. Beads on rods. Still used in some places.
Pascal invented mechanical calculator (1642). Addition, subtraction.
Alan Turing - Turing machine concept, breaking Enigma. Father of computer science.
Grace Hopper - first compiler, COBOL. Pioneer in programming.
Creeper (1971) - first computer virus. Experimental. Displayed message.

prompt: First computer mouse was made of?
explanation: First mouse (1964) by Douglas Engelbart - wooden, one button.
First website 1991 at CERN by Tim Berners-Lee. Info about WWW project.
First email 1971 by Ray Tomlinson. He chose @ for addresses.

prompt: @ symbol in email was chosen by?
explanation: Ray Tomlinson chose @ for email - separates user from host.
Tim Berners-Lee invented WWW at CERN, Switzerland, 1989.
IBM Simon (1994) - first smartphone. Touchscreen, apps. iPhone popularized.
Amazon started as online bookstore 1994. Jeff Bezos. Expanded to everything.
Wikipedia launched 2001. Free, collaborative encyclopedia.
YouTube founded 2005. Acquired by Google 2006.
Facebook launched 2004 by Mark Zuckerberg. Harvard initially.
Twitter had 140 chars, increased to 280. Now X.
WhatsApp acquired by Facebook (now Meta) 2014.
Paytm founded 2010 by Vijay Shekhar Sharma. Digital payments, wallet.
NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) set up 2008. UPI, RuPay, IMPS.
PARAM 8000 (1991) - India's first indigenous supercomputer. C-DAC developed.
